title: Tewu 02
description: Comprehensive practice test covering Governance, Stakeholder Engagement, and Life Cycle Management.

questions.text: The Manage Portfolio Risksprocess has how many stages? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 8.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The Aligning Process Group is most active when? (Moderate)

options.text: After the portfolio organization has defined and developed its plans
After the portfolio organization has defined and developed its strategic goals
After the portfolio organization has defined its near term budget

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Hal approaches you for advice. He is about to start working on the Define Portfolio process and feels as though everything has already been defined and that this process can be skipped. How would you advise Hal? (Difficult)

options.text: I would advise Hal that he can skip the process and proceed to do a portfolio component inventory
I would advise Hal that the he is correct and the process can be skipped.
I would advise Hal that the process should not be skipped and is important because it provides a graphical overview of key portfolio elements
I would advise Hal that the process should not be skipped and is important because the portfolio needs to be organized for evaluation, selection, and prioritization.

questions.explanation: This is a very important process involving organizing the portfolio. Refer to Section 5.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The best tool to develop a stakeholder communication management strategy is: (Moderate)

options.text: Mapping of internal and external stakeholders to quadrants
Mapping of communication assets to quadrants
Mapping of influence and interest to quadrants
Mapping of organization chart to quadrants based on influence

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 7.1.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The communication management plan should include all of the following except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 7.1.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How does a manager measure portfolio component performance? (Moderate)

options.text: Portfolio component is undertaken to achieve a strategic goal and its contribution is measured within the context of that goal
Portfolio component is undertaken to achieve primarily a financial goal
Portfolio component is undertaken to achieve primarily a human resource goal
Portfolio component is undertaken to achieve one or more strategic goals

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 1.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How does a portfolio manager address the function of quality management? (Moderate)

options.text: Not a factor as portfolio managers look at multiple areas
Ensuring compliance with voluntary standards and OSHA requirements
Ensuring compliance with voluntary standards and mandatory requirements

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 1.7 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How does the portfolio management plan utilize information from the roadmap? (Moderate)

options.text: To define low level schedules and timelines

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The following types of diagrams are all useful to show execution of the portfolio against the overall strategic plan and budget except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 6.2.3.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is "Change" defined for portfolio management? (Easy)

options.text: Depending on organizations, it can be a random process
Occurs in the broader internal and external environment monitored by the manager
Strictly internal controls that are monitored by the manager
Occurs in the broader internal and external environment but not necessarily monitored

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is organizational strategy implemented as it relates to the strategic plan? (Easy)

options.text: Through portfolio components and ongoing operations
Through the capability and capacity analysis

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.1.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Ron is working on his portfolio charter and is trying to assess the impact of enterprise environmental factors. Which of the follow scenarios could Ron be facing? (Difficult)

options.text: The portfolio structure needs to be changed so that it aligns stakeholder relationships, scope, benefits, and portfolio goals
The portfolio charter needs to be changed to account for the results of the capability and capacity analysis
The portfolio charter needs to align with scenarios examined during scenario analysis
The portfolio structure in the charter needs to align with corporate accounting structure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.2.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is the portfolio related to the process Define Portfolio Roadmap? (Easy)

options.text: It quantifies the estimated costs and benefits of portfolio components
It is used to perform a portfolio component inventory
It is used to define organization areas only on the portfolio roadmap
The portfolio and components are referenced to define the portfolio roadmap

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.3.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How is the portfolio management plan utilized during the Manage Portfolio Value process? (Moderate)

options.text: It provides for the continual identification and assessment of the value of the portfolio benefits and the impact on organizational objectives
It provides a high-level timeline for expected portfolio component delivery

It provides stakeholder expectations and requirements, governance model, strategic change framework, planning, procurement, and oversight processes including direction for performance, communication, and risk management

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.3.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The least likely factors that affect portfolio structural risks is: (Moderate)

options.text: Alignment of organizations ability to organize its portfolio mission with hierarchal and clustered structures
Methods and approaches in which organization operates and performs its tasks

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How many people may be in the governing body? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.9 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How many portfolio management processes are there? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How many portfolio management process groups are there? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: How many Portfolio Communication Management Processes are there? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 7 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Why might portfolio process assets need to be updated as a result of the Optimize Portfolio process? (Moderate)

options.text: Procedures and guidelines have changed during the process
The approach and criteria to maintaining a balanced portfolio may have changed during the process
Organizational areas, portfolio components, and high level timeline have changed during the process

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 5.3.3.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: All of the following are key descriptors of portfolio components that a portfolio manager may make use of except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.2.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: All of the following are valid for scoring and measuring organizational value except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6.3.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The performance management process manages the sourcing of: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 6 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio manager must have expertise in ALL of the following application and analysis of quantitative and qualitative techniques except: (Easy)

options.text: Program And project management methods and techniques

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 1.8 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio charter is defined as: (Difficult)

options.text: The document that formally establishes the portfolio change management plan
The document that formally authorizes and structures a portfolio
The document that provides the scope and schedule of establishing the portfolio management process
The process that initiation the formation of a portfolio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio charter contains which of the following? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 3.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio roadmap displays information at what type of level and what type of view? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.3.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio management plan may refer to different methodologies or approaches that the organization applies to manage different types of portfolio components. This is done based on the specifications from what? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 5.1.1.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The portfolio management plan can include each of the following sections except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: Refer to Section 5.1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Rod recently started working on the Develop Portfolio Communication Management Plan process. He is trying to locate information on portfolio value assessments and portfolio manager roles and responsibilities. Where can he find this information? (Difficult)
questions.explanation: Information on portfolio value assessments and portfolio manager roles and responsibilities are part of portfolio process assets. Refer to Section 7.1.1.5 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The risk register includes all of the following information except: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 8.2.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: The strategic change process compares: (Moderate)

options.text: The "as is" state with the "to be" state
The current state with the ideal state
The present state with the past state

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Lisa Fe has just started working on the Develop Portfolio Performance Management Plan process. She is trying to find information on stakeholder expectation and requirements as well as information about planning and procurement. Where should she look for this information? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The portfolio management plan contains information on stakeholder expectations, planning, and procurement. Refer to Section 6.1.1.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Melanie has sought advice from Glenn, a senior member of her office, regarding managing strategic change. Glenn indicated to Melanie that a stakeholder analysis is very important. Why? (Difficult)

options.text: It is used to understand the portfolio structure, scope, constraints, dependencies, and resources
It compares the current portfolio mix and components with the new strategic direction and the "to-be" organizational vision
It is used to evaluate strategic objectives, prioritize objectives, and perform strategic assessments again current enterprise portfolios
It helps to ensure continuity and aligns key stakeholders' expectations with the changing strategy and resulting portfolio realignment

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 4.4.2.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: Bruce is currently working on the Optimize Portfolio process and asks for your guidance. Bruce has decided to remove a portfolio component and knows that his reasoning needs to be documented, but isn't sure where he should document it. How would you advise him (Difficult)

options.text: I would advise Bruce to document his reasoning on the portfolio roadmap
I would advise Bruce to document his reasoning in the portfolio charter
I would advise Bruce to document his reasoning in the portfolio management plan
I would advise Bruce to document his reasoning in the portfolio component information

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.3.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 7.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

options.text: I would advise Bruce to document his reasoning on the portfolio roadmap

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 7.1.3.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 39. Which factors indicate that there is a need to revise portfolio components? (Difficult)

options.text: Change in priorities, regulatory changes, portfolio process assets
Enterprise environmental factors, organizational process assets, portfolio strategic plan
Obsolete goals, opportunities to be pursued, and response to regular changes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Results of the analysis become part of the portfolio process assets but they are not a factor in revising portfolio components. Refer to Section 4.1.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 40. Which is NOT an assessment activity of the portfolio management process? (Moderate)

options.text: Evaluate existing portfolio components to determine if supportive of organization strategy and objectives
Identify gaps in knowledge, structure, resources, processes
assess current portfolio component resource availability and allocations against integrated schedule

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 41. Which is NOT included in assessment results of the portfolio management process? (Moderate)

options.text: Misinformation that needs to be addressed
Project, program, portfolio and operations management practices in place

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 42. Which of the following is NOT considered a primary activity for portfolio management? (Select the best answer) (Difficult)

options.text: Managing the details of programs and projects
Determining a governance and performance management framework

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. Refer to Section 1.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 43. Which of the following ways does a PMO NOT support Portfolio Management: (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A. Refer to Section 1.9 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.explanation: Refer to Section 4.1 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 46. Which of the four Portfolio Strategic Management processes involves an output of high-level portfolio planning that graphically depicts all portfolio elements need to achieve organizational strategy and objectives? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 4.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 47. Which of the four Portfolio Strategic Management processes examines the "as-is" state and compares it with the "to-be" state? (Easy)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Refer to Section 4.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 48. Which of the following is an example (or examples) of evaluation criteria that a portfolio manager should apply? (Moderate)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.2.2 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 49. Which of the following best describes portfolio optimization? (Moderate)

options.text: Maximizing portfolio return within the organizations predefined risk profile and tolerances
Balancing the portfolio for value delivery
Planning and allocating resources according to organizational strategy and objectives

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.3 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.

questions.text: 50. Which of the following are key activities with the Authorize Portfolio process? (Moderate)

options.text: Allocating resources to authorized portfolio components
Authorizing portfolio component proposal development or portfolio component execution
Communicating changes and decisions for the authorized portfolio components

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Refer to Section 5.4 of the Standard for Portfolio Management - 3rd Edition. Review the descriptions and definition.
